text:
Man, this is a shame- I got this far into the thread thinking you might, MIGHT have been worth defending- After all, you present a very correct opinion at the start, and defend it rationally for a while.
And then this.
You sir, are hereby found guilty of Irrational Dickery to Strangers. Go to the station and turn in your humanity.

name: ariamaki
text:
There are exactly two unfunny things here:
1, I am out of lames.
2, I cannot lame you past my three-digit threshold.

It is a damn shame, it is.

name: dartigen
text:
Penny Arcade is occasionally good. It started out well, faltered, got better, faltered...occasionally they manage sarcasm, but rarely actual humour.
Achewood is consistently good, if not always funny. You might not always spray your drink onto your monitor while laughing, but you will at least go 'yeah that was pretty good'.

name: thescrivener
text: Odd, because while I read P-A regularly, I laugh out loud more at Achewood's humor more than just about all other webcomics together.  It's not my favorite, I don't necessarily think it's the best or even funniest webcomic around - but I laugh out loud more often at this strip than any others.  I don't think I'm alone in this.

name: lolsworth
text: Pity chubby

name: saint
text: talk hard! say opinions!

name: ih8jonmayr
text: Penny Arcade is somewhat funny for awhile, until you realize how formulaic it really is. Every single Penny Arcade: Game reference, then some dude swearing.

name: ariamaki
text:
Hi!
You have obviously never read more then a dozen PA comics, and then attempted to have an opinion on it.
Thank you for trying though, it was kind of you.

name: gitarooman
text: Seriously dude, I know I'm late to the party but Penny Arcade fucking blows. It is one of the worst webcomics on the internet, and the fact that you think that it is "laugh-out-loud funny" on a regular basis means there is something wrong with your sense of humour. These aren't opinions, this is a stone cold fact: Penny Arcade blows. Achewood is not only more detailed and features an actual story, but every single gag is about 100x funnier than a penny arcade strip. Also you have a shitty nerd "musician" as your avatar so you are obviously a stupid nerd from some other part of the internet. You have the worst opinions on the internet and I would take 5 asherdans or soticos or saints over you. tl;dr: GTFO i don't like nerds

name: neonaoneo
text:
opinion = fact

doesn't like nerds
is on internet

lolwut

name: headphones
text:
oh come on now, everyone on the internet is a nerd?

listen guy, the only reason i'm replying to your comment is because apparently when people do that you read them. it is okay to have opinions, and clearly you do. but you have gone beyond the level of "dissident" to become "asshole" and your opinion has nothing to do with the upgrade. you are most likely savvy enough to understand what a troll is, and despite your, if annoying, well-reasoned comments that is what you have become. it is two years later and you are still involved with this thread. let it go. just let it go. it's too late to redeem yourself, the least you could do is let it go. there is no reason to ever get worked up about anything on the internet unless it is applicable to the non-internet part of reality. this isn't hearts, you get one heart (a lame, in this analogy) and then you go "fuck, i might as well try and shoot the moon." we can all see clearly that this thread has prompted you to, at the very least, reply to everyone who commented on your dissidence and if that reveals anything about your character it is this: you like penny arcade way too much.

name: neonaoneo
text:
It has revealed this - every few months I load Achewood up, click inbox, and then troll people who have replied to my messages.

This is hard to understand how?

name: neonaoneo
text: The real humdinger is, why do people reply to my two year old comments to complain in the first place? SCIENCE

name: sustainability
text: What the fuck, man, two years later you're still on the same ragefest? There's like a zillion pages in the archives to troll.

name: supadupa
text: Yeah, Ray's face is priceless

name: mercuri0us
text: Well, this episode is about wangs...

I only know what it looked like when it was the enemy.

I was Sega-exclusive until the day they stopped being an option... which is when I threw in my lot and became exclusively Anti-S*ny.

text: Soticoto is 100% bottom.

name: ariamaki
text: Soticoto is a sock-puppet for Pat.

name: soticoto
text:
My uncontrollable disgust at even the idea of anal penetration exempts me from such things.
Not even sure why I have such a thing, as the idea of cutting the top of someone's skull off and fucking their brain appeals to me.

name: you_bastard
text: Satoru Iwata is interchangeable with phallic.

text: maybe it'll work if you take it out and blow on it

text: Perhaps. But I am sure of one thing: Onstad sure likes to draw penises. Let's see, there was the chicken penis, the skateboarding penis, the Chinese takeout penis, the rock-hard cat cack, and now Nintendo wang. Did I miss any?

Got me on a technicallity, you did.

Although Achewood's finest "penis" moment remains... the skateboard penis:

aggh....here http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uua8fj6rT

name: area_homosexual
text:
- Weird bug-eyed Ray and Roast Beef strip; ends with Ray in a wheelchair and Beef with his wang out.
Wait did you cover that already? Were you being rhetorical? Wanna play x-box?

name: fineoakstructure
text: Did Chris see Superbad this past weekend?

name: equinn2006
text: I believe he did. Or else Ray is just part of the, like, 8 percent of kids who do this.

name: j-man
text: I wonder if Ray keeps a Ghostbusters lunch-box dick treasure chest.

name: spinynorman
text: Wow, 8 percent? You'd think I'd see a lot more faces at the support meetings, then...

name: ntopp
text: "Wow. Okay. Now, how about that one Tiananmen Square picture with the tanks."

name: killerlimpet
text:
all tiny milgramized members lined up on the street

all cock with huge huevos standing in front of them

name: dzieger
text: Chubbied for the use of the word "milgramized"

name: ntopp
text:
Well, I just learned all about the Milgram experiment.
So thank you for that.

name: killerlimpet
text:
See also the Stanford prison experiment and the Bobo doll experiment.

Aren't we a trainwreck of a species?

name: slalvation
text: Stanford prison experiment. My actual favorite experiment in the history.

name: tekende
text: It was a terrifying experiment. I watched a documentary on it in a class once and I had trouble sleeping that night.

name: tropicana
text: That is too cute not to mock up.

name: katsura
text: If I could chubby this comment a hundred times, I WOULD.

name: ferryboy
text: I'm surprised I had to read this far in the comments before I read something about Superbad. I was beginning to feel cold and alone.

name: shoinan
text: A comment left by shoinan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by madnes, kylank, ShiroBen, equinn2006, sigmacoder, Wolfslice)

name: dougthehead
text: A comment left by dougthehead was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by madnes, kylank, ShiroBen, sigmacoder)

name: dougthehead
text:
Dang it, shoinan beat me to it. Okay, in that case I'll go with comment #2:

Ray is the Jim Halpert of pretending to have unlikely artistic conditions.

name: honesttom
text: I was going to make the same joke as shoinan, too. I'd say "great minds think alike", but I think it would not be appropriate for a Wii joke.

name: bhlaab
text: A comment left by bhlaab was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by HonestTom, mer, emilyfun)

name: paperboy_2000
text: Shame on Ray for pretending to such a serious condition.  Graphic artists so afflicted are limited to careers at Chinese take-out joints or doing portraiture of Philippe.

name: neonfreon
text: One of my friends is a struggling graphic artist (sorry for the redundancy) - he got a job at a chinese takeout place, managed to keep it for all of an hour and a half before he ate a piece of someone's leftover General Tso's chicken and was fired on the spot.

name: senseihollywood
text:
I think we all know the real reason your friend got fired...
[IMGS OFF]

name: ntopp
text: Is basically thought we are all havink.

name: mrj428
text: Doesn%u2019t this strip reference prove that Onstad has made phallus drawing jokes before and therefore he did not rip off Superbad?

name: grayfox
text: I do not think there is anything original about drawing penises, so there is nothing to be "ripped off".  The drawing of the penises is merely a prop used for the interaction between Teodor and Ray.

name: niggar
text: A comment left by niggar was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Tony, Sprog, sigmacoder, Awko)

name: tombsgrave
text: The second, actually, the first being Swarthy Teen Phillipe playing a bleeping, blooping mystery-game.  Onstad does not roll with the medium of video games.

name: hellweek
text: Third. Lyle and the importing of Urine Cop.

name: honesttom
text: Does the whole Oregon Trail arc count?

name: shoinan
text:
The alt text also suggests that Chris is not a fan of video games.

On another note there is something that Ray's drawing and a Nintendo have in common: If you play with either of them too much you'll end up blind.

name: tombsgrave
text: Stupid radiation beaming into my eyeballs... stupid addictive video gaming.

name: estutius
text: so oregon trail isn't a video game?

name: gormster
text: A comment left by gormster was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by DR_MANFLESH_DESIRES_ANAL_PLAY_IMMEDIATELY, Tony, mortshire, gbeaton, nonorganon)

name: ntopp
text: Tell that to the pile of buffalo corpses left just outside the starting town.

name: gormster
text: Oh, god dammit. I never actually played Oregon Trail (we had different 'educational' games in this country) and I thought it was text-only. Fuck it.

name: fosters
text:
You, sir, have had a deprived childhood. Never fear! Go to this website:

http://www.virtualapple.org/2listO.html

and check it out right now. (It may be less fun for someone who isn't playing it while riding a wave of nostalgia and hash, though.) Odell Lake is also awesome, although with the same caveat.

name: mashuren
text: Don't forget Roast Beef's Tetris Crisis

name: grayfox
text: I just noticed Cornelius' car is RHD, that is awesome.

name: area_homosexual
text: Though no match for the omega, the "s" and reverse "s" shaped pieces were always shit; you could finish off a row with them, but they never figured into a double. Also bad: excessive ambition resulting in, like, 9 solid unfinished lines waiting for the upper-case "I".

name: xaxx
text: You can totally get a double with an s or z.  You know you can rotate the blocks in Tetris, yes?

name: lateadopter
text:
Panel 7: Teodor realizes that Ray's all goofing on him, and in Teodor's own element, no less.

Panel 8: Mission Accomplished.

name: tombsgrave
text: Nintendo are wider than they are long, ergo they are not normally penises.

name: dr_sexlove
text: Nintendo ain't no choad. you might call it one, but it'll just sit there, being a Nintendo, and you'll be wrong.

name: sicsemper
text: Er, what if you just turned a NES 90 degrees? Instant longer-than-it-is-wide orientation.

name: tombsgrave
text: Curses!  That changes everything!

name: lateadopter
text: On you, maybe.

name: theoneyouwant
text: even though i have one, penises are one of the funnier things in life.

name: sweatpantsninja
text: A comment left by sweatpantsninja was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Tony, gbeaton, STUART)

name: gormster
text: you know you can reply directly to comments, right? That's how the appear underneath the one you're responding to (like this one.) Hit the little 'reply' link under a comment to reply to it.

name: astro_zombie
text: Ray fucks with Teodor in the strangest ways.

name: rotating-dog
text: I think this strip may have an extra level of meaning for Xbox enthusiasts.

name: shoinan
text: Actually with the way the Nintendo Wii is going, this could feasibly be a new attachment for it. Sure it's not family fun but we all know every kid above the age of 10 does it. I can see it now: Super Mario Rubs One Out.

name: gormster
text: Attachment? Who needs an attachment? I think this is already one of the games in WarioWare.

name: zefiel
text: I see you guys also read VGcats.

name: johnnylandmine
text: VGCats is kind of like bizarro-Achewood. Both strips are about talking cats, but one of them is yet another played-out video game webcomic and the other is funny.

name: zefiel
text:
Which one is which? WE REPORT, YOU DECIDE!


..no, seriously, I'm fucking tired of VGcats. Chris takes as long to update, but at least his comics are GOOD.

name: gormster
text: I actually don't. I read a scant ten webcomics, and VGcats is not good enough to make that list.

name: incendiary
text: what are these scant ten?

name: zefiel
text: oh no way man you don't want this to degenerate on everyone listing their favorite comics. all hip and trendy. all Perry Bible Fellowship right after Achewood.

name: andrew_
text: I've never been able to pick between the two.

name: gormster
text: man, now I want to do it just to piss you off. in no particular order; PA, goats, DS, achewood, overcompensating, qwantz, BNS, dr mcninja, xkcd, PBF.

name: taiiga
text:
pbf is probably the best illustrated comic like, ever

yeah that's pretty much what it is

name: riazm
text: People all claiming they have Maakies prints, some guy talking about his Kochalka diaries subscription.

name: garlic_breath
text: I want to know what other people's favorite webcomics are.  Actually I found your comment funny because I am (obv.) not hip to these things and the only other one I've found is Perry Bible Fellowship, because I'm not into the videogames or fantasy stuff so much.  I do like to read Dykes To Watch Out For online, too, I guess, but that's not really a webcomic.

name: andrew_
text: God damnit , Ray.

name: ngazin
text: Was this inspired by Superbad?

name: dans
text:
Woah, this strip makes me question a lot of others.
Like that one where he's learned German? Exactly how clever is this cat?

name: halofyre
text: Ray is a dude who would see Superbad and do this to someone like Teodor, who is not a dude who would see Superbad.

name: sizone
text: The meta-joke has now been established. Kudos to you.

name: songbirdspectre
text: oh. my god.

name: anitrophaeron
text: As I am also not the kind of guy who saw superbad, can someone explain what the similarity is?

name: lazarusloafer
text: One of the characters had an affliction as a child that caused him to compulsively draw penises.

name: honesttom
text: Apparently the artist behind Tank Girl and Gorillaz, Jamie Hewlett, also had this compulsion.

name: katsura
text: So is that why he marketed a line of vibrators with his artwork on them?

name: honesttom
text: I did not know he had done this. Apparently the Gentlemen's Prerogatives in question were always drawn hammer-shaped, I don't know if that's reflected in the Lady Toys here referred to.

name: budenhagen
text: Ray OBVIOUSLY drew The Zapper with a wig on. Teodor just jumped to the wrong conclusion.

name: robotman
text: A comment left by robotman was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by illgamesh, peterjoel, aperson)

name: fineoakstructure
text: Probably; the main reason being that he has a kid, and kid people do not see movies in the theatre any where near within 3 weeks of the movie's release.  It's most likely just an odd happenstance, but curious nonetheless.

name: clever-nickname
text:
yeah, didn't two different guys invent the telephone or something?

shut up, i think it's relevant.

name: zedpower
text: Two guys invented the telephone at the same time. Suprised the hell out of both when one of them first tried it and the other dude answered.

name: gerry
text:
Charles Darwin came up with his theory of natural selection and sat on it for like 20 years ago (he was apparently worried about the implications of his theory) and when he found out that this other dude was also about to publish a theory of natural selection, he was like "oh shit! I better publish mine!" Luckily he was kinda buds with the other dude and the other dude was like "your theory is better than mine anyway, so you should get the credit."

Also there was that time when two movies came out and they were about volcanos.

name: zefiel
text:
What about those movies with meteors just mowing us all down

Did you watch those

name: biff
text: I watched both. Deep Impact had bad science in it, and Armageddon had stupid bad science in it. It was like it was a competition over which movie could rape science the worst..

name: killerlimpet
text: And then The Core went and won.

name: zefiel
text: Sunshine.

So I guess this means The Case of The Cum Shot will forever be a mystery?
Oh well, at least we still get penises.

name: valrus
text:
Sung to the tune of "If You're Happy And You Know It":

If it's longer than it's wide, it's a phallus
If it's longer than it's wide, it's a phallus
If it's not longer than it's wide
Then just turn it on its side
Then it's longer than it's wide and it's a phallus

text:
You get a chubby
a. because the song is awesome
b. and stuck in my head
c. I am soothed by seeing "it's" and "its" used correctly

name: foolio
text: I've heard this song before...where is it from? Is it from a movie or something, or is it a schoolyard thing?

name: whasit
text: I remember being made to sing it a lot in elementary school?  I don't actually remember where I learned it first.

name: slalvation
text: I cannot give this a chubby because the Acheworld police have decided I am Too Friendly. But I want you to know that this is a very good thing you have done here today (three months ago).

text: This strips is very much like that movie that just came out, Superbad.

name: twoply
text: Oh yeah.... did anyone mention yet this is like Superbad in any way? I've been searching this page and no individual had mentioned this bears a faint resemblance to  Superbad. ;)

name: thommy_h
text: Wow, good call! It's just like that scene! You'd think it would have come up already. It's so obvious in retrospect.

text: I was hoping this strip reference some recent teen angst movie.

name: gormster
text: clearly.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
for what it's worth, I think the reason for the Superbad connection is not just "penis doodle jokes," but the fact that both focus on some one who has a problem in which that's all they can draw; odd coincidence.

And as the person who first posted the "did he see superbad?" question, I also wonder why so many people seemed to keep asking the same damn question. I figured the topic had been covered.

name: zefiel
text: A comment left by zefiel was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by HonestTom, mania3, Siah)

name: fineoakstructure
text:
oh hell yess 'stad saw the S'bad. ignore it if you must, you North American.

but really, zefiel, c'mon...the topic has been covered. sarcastic zingers included.

name: zefiel
text: That movie will be called 'Supercool' here in mexico. I shit you not, i just saw the poster. I guess here EVERYTHING IS backwards.

name: fineoakstructure
text: you know, it really works about the same either way.  "Superbad" is not a very original name.  Seth Rogen lazy.  No excuse for crap like that.

name: pyromancer
text: Ray may be just goofing on Teodor, but recent trends indicate to me that he seriously needs to see some lady action soon.

text: A comment left by thommy_h was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Tinhand, Paperboy_2000, old_chap, lastlarf, Darthemed)

name: detventrilo
text: So, kind of off topic, but I received my Great Outdoor Fight tshirt the other day.  I wore it for the first time yesterday, and nearly got in a fight.  True story.

name: mrj428
text: No Shit!  The same thing happened to me when I wore mine.

name: afkpuz
text:
Really?

Damn, a guy on the subway just complimented me on mine when I got it.

Although I suppose that was pretty awesome.

name: zefiel
text: You were supposed to clock his ass in ways people thought could not be done.

name: afkpuz
text: Well I mean it wasn't really outdoors; I guess I could have, but it wouldn't have been a thing.

name: honesttom
text: In my part of the world, "clock" means "look at". It took a few seconds for me to get that comment. I thought you were advising afkpuz to use infra-red binoculars to check asses out.

name: zefiel
text: Well that's not bad advice per se

name: afkpuz
text:
Indeed frankly I approve of this concept.

Zefiel you have been incidental here!

text:
That is some rad chillies.

I've been drunk in my Dude & Catastrophe hoody, but that's all.

text: Man, it's not a rip off, that kid in Superbad didn't draw dicks accidentally. He did it because he was obsessed with drawing them, not because he was attempting to draw a Nintendo. (of course this is assuming Ray isn't lying and really can't draw anything but phalli).

name: boheeka
text: I can just see the obliviously angry fanboys now.

name: javonathan
text: Ray is sitting at a drawing table. He calls Teodor over to tell him about a problem he is having. Apparently, Ray cannot draw anything without it becoming a penis. Teodor, skeptical of Ray's condition, tells Ray to draw a loaf of sourdough bread. This comes out as a penis. Teodor is concerenedly amazed. Teodor asks Ray to draw a Nintendo Entertainment System. Ray illustrates the request as the male genitalia adorned with pubic hair. Teodor sees through the ruse. He leaves, upset. Ray is delighted with his joke. He continues to draw phalluses until Cornelius or Roast Beef comes in.

when will you learn the golden rule, Zefiel?

name: carnelian
text: This is classic achewood. The look on Ray's face at his success is wonderful

name: molesticide
text:
fuck you people i tried reading through the comments here but between all the lames and all the links and the sheer size of the page it was taking me longer to wait for something to happen than to actually experience it, I GIVE UP less than a quarter of the way through.

go to HELL

name: alzuna
text:
I agree somewhat. I start reading a long conversation (usually a heated argument) for some reason, I guess they are usually interesting? and then after like 4 or 5 scrolls down, I'm just like bla I could be reading another strip.

Not that I have a problem with discourse at all, go ahead talk amongst yourselves.

name: foxtrotamend
text: Ray's smile in the last panel is pure comedic gold.

text:
Teodor, panel 7:
dammit, he was right!

text: Reminiscent of Gibby Haynes' "Perfect Pencil" joke; see Our Band Could Be Your Life by Michael Azerrad, Boston : Little, Brown, 2001
